definitions.definition: The act of speaking in a quiet voice , especially without vibration of the vocal cords .
examples: I spoke in a near whisper .
There are whispers of rebellion all around.

definitions.definition: A faint trace or hint (of something).
examples: The soup had just a whisper of basil.

definitions.definition: A low rustling sound , like that of the wind in leaves .
A private message to an individual in a chat room .

main_definition: The act of speaking in a quiet voice , especially without vibration of the vocal cords .
secondary_definitions: ( usually in the plural ) A rumor .
( figurative ) A faint trace or hint (of something).
A low rustling sound , like that of the wind in leaves .
( Internet ) A private message to an individual in a chat room .
